p.d: British Summer Time returns to Londonâ€™s Hyde Park for a run of incredible performances. This ninety-minute special captures the highlights from some of the biggest acts in the world performing to an audience of over 60,000 fans, reveling under the summer sunshine. Tom Petty & The Heartbreakers on their 40th anniversary, and what was to be their final tour, play their monster hits Learning To Fly and Refugee. The Killers with their iconic hits Mr Brightside and Human showed just what a formidable headline band they are with their world famous energetic showmanship. Finally, Kings Of Leon deliver on their high-octane tracks, smashing out the roaring stadium anthems Use Somebody and Sex On Fire. Highlights also include performances from Stevie Nicks, Elbow, Tears For Fears, Pixies, Nathaniel Rateliff & The Night Sweats, The Lumineers and Cold War Kids.
